title.narrative: Mozambique (le): Aide ciblée aux pays
Mozambique: Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

Cette activité détaille notre travail sur le Aide ciblée aux pays en Mozambique (le), grâce à la mise à disposition des données budgétaires et des transactions. Nous fournissons également les documents pertinents qui guident ces activités que sont les formulaires de demande de soutien fournis par le gouvernement de Mozambique (le) ainsi que les lettres de décisions émises par Gavi, pour progresser. Ces documents décrivent les activités, les objectifs ainsi que les bénéficiaires.

This activity details our work on Targeted country assistance in Mozambique through the provision of budget and transaction data. We also provide the relevant documents that guide these activities, which are the support request proposal(s) provided by the Government of Mozambique, as well as the decision letter(s) issued by Gavi, for progress. These documents describe the activities, the objectives as well as the beneficiaries.

condition.narrative: Conditions are detailed in the Partners’ engagement framework
Conditions are detailed in the Partners’ engagement framework

title.narrative: CDC Foundation
1. Feedback report of results to sentinel sites and stakeholders 2. Consistent reporting of at least 80% of suspect pediatric meningitis cases (< 15 years of age) across all three sites.

target.value: 1. Continue to provide epidemiologic and laboratory assistance to enhance surveillance for vaccine-preventable bacterial meningitis in three sentinel sites (Maputo, Nampula and Beira). 2. Build national capacity for molecular detection of vaccine-preventable bacterial pathogens at INS 3. Enhance case finding and reporting of suspect meningitis cases and transport of cerebral fluid specimens for molecular diagnosis at the national level to evaluate changes on the pneumococcal vaccination program.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
REC plan developed, monitored and documented in 100% of distritcs targetted in Zambezia (considering the articulation of community mapping, micro-planning and reorganization of service provision (MB)

target.value: Accelerate and stabilize rollout of the RED/REC strategy in Zambezia
Accelerate and stabilize rollout of the RED/REC strategy in Zambezia

title.narrative: John Snow, Inc. : Programme Management - General
100% of JSI-supported prioritized districts have a data verification rate of at least 80% through supportive supervision or DQS.

target.value: Continued support for RED/REC at the provincial level

title.narrative: Lessons Learned on RED/REC implementation/rollout documented and shared with MISAU and Gavi

target.value: Continued support for RED/REC at the provincial level.

title.narrative: Acasus : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)
Workshop on data use and analysis conducted in Tete province

target.value: Conduct capacity building workshops for provincial EPI teams to build capability on data use and analysis

title.narrative: Develop and disseminate a short set of best practices identified in Mozambique and other contexts relevant to Mozambique (Learning) (M

target.value: Ensure strong focus on capacity building and developing guidelines and SOPs for efficient handover.

title.narrative: Outreach working session(s) held and plan of action agreed

target.value: Support central level working session(s) to analyse and plan outreach activities and monthly central level outreach (RED/REC) review meetings for improved outreach activity levels across the country through EPI's RED/REC strategy implementation

title.narrative: Workshop on data use and analysis conducted in Manica, Nampula and Zambezia

target.value: Conduct capacity building workshops for provincial EPI teams to build capability on data use and analysis

title.narrative: EPI staff are trained on how to handle FESP, including development of data packs and problem-solving using data collected at health facility level

target.value: Roll out use of the supervisory app when implementing district-level supervision visits and drive up compliance in the four provinces, including transitioning to EPI and partners where possible. Contribute to EPI efforts to review, coordinate and rationalise existing supervision and data quality interventions improvement efforts led by WHO.

title.narrative: Progress report on sustainability and transition plan implementation

target.value: Implement sustainability and transition plan to ensure all key tasks, including planning, data/technology and implementation support are handed over
Implement sustainability and transition plan to ensure all key tasks, including planning, data/technology and implementation support are handed over

title.narrative: To be determined according to requested support

target.value: Provide technical assistance to strengthen planning and management practices at central and provincial level, as requested

title.narrative: A sustainability plan to guide handover of supervisory application (FESP) to central and provincial EPI teams

target.value: Roll out use of the supervisory app when implementing district-level supervision visits and drive up compliance in the four provinces, including transitioning to EPI and partners where possible. Contribute to EPI efforts to review, coordinate and rationalise existing supervision and data quality interventions improvement efforts led by WHO.

title.narrative: Plan of action progress reviewed (50% complete?) and updated as necessary

target.value: Support central level working session(s) to analyse and plan outreach activities and monthly central level outreach (RED/REC) review meetings for improved outreach activity levels across the country through EPI's RED/REC strategy implementation

title.narrative:
Data packs on supervision results shared on a monthly basis with provincial and district EPI teams
Participation in data review meeting in Tete province

target.value: Support provincial and district EPI managers to use the data and results of supervision to improve performance

title.narrative:
Data packs on supervision results shared on a monthly basis with provincial and district EPI teams
Participation in quarterly data review meetings in Tete, Manica, Nampula and Zambezia

target.value: Support provincial and district EPI managers to use the data and results of supervision to improve performance

title.narrative: Quarterly report on progress achieved against action plans developed for priority provinces

target.value: Track performance of priority province plans of action

title.narrative: John Snow, Inc.
Tools and approaches developed to improve and sustain quality and safety of immunisation services.

target.value: Conduct supportive supervision and monitor HPV introduction in Nampula, Tete, Sofala and Manica.

title.narrative: Readiness assessment at national and district levels provided as per agreed time points; HPV Introduction plan (and micro plans) developed; Monitoring tools adapted to incorporate HPV; HPV Training tool for HCW

target.value: HPV vaccine planning and implementation: support MoH to develop the national HPV introduction plan, HPV target group setting and identification for HPV introduction; adapt existing monitoring tools to incorporate HPV; Support the coordination of the HPV roll out at central level, support MOH to conduct readiness assessments ahead introduction, fill in readiness assessment at relevant levels; develop training tools and co-facilitate training for health workers on HPV introduction at national and subnational levels (in Nampula, Manica, Sofala and Tete)

title.narrative: RED/REC Lessons learned on implementation documented and shared.

target.value: Provide guidance and coordination with the national EPI to strengthen immunization programming and ensure capacity transfer through TWG.

title.narrative: HPV national committee established and operational.

target.value: Support the establishment and coordination of the national coordination HPV committees to link with traditional and non-traditional stakeholders (e.g. CSOs, professional associations, adolescent health groups and others working with eligible girls and cancer prevention) in the planning and implementation process of HPV.

title.narrative: Facility RED/REC microplans updated with particular attention to zero-dose and under-immunized children.

target.value: Continue support RED/REC to boost the capacity of the DPSs in the three current provinces (Sofala, Manica and Nampula) for better planning and implement RED/REC components in the priority 25 districts (including 14 new priorities districts) and start with transition out of the need for direct TA. Also extend support to Tete to improve performance and adherence to the operational components including REC for training, micro-planning, engage community actors to reach the underserved, and on-going monitoring.

title.narrative: REC indicators are fully monitored at Provincial/District and National levels.

target.value: Contribute to integrating the RED/REC indicators into SIS-MA/District Health Information Software(DHIS) 2.

title.narrative: Zero-dose and under immunized children identified in each high priority districts

target.value: Identify, quantify and reach zero-dose and under-immunized children in target districts where JSI is working

title.narrative: UNICEF
50% of the activities as per the action plan implemented in Zambezia and Nampula (with CIDA funds)

target.value: Provide support for Implementation of the EPI communication plan 2017-2020

title.narrative: UNICEF : Health Financing/Sustainability
Funds allocation for 2022 respecting high priority district equity and coverage criterias

target.value: Support the EPI TWGs (Service Delivery and Finance) to establish a fund allocation mechanism to districts, based on population density, access and use of immunização services and the existing health network, to equitably raise global coverage.

title.narrative: Developed and approved District Equity funds attribution mechanism for EPI based on coverage and equity criterias

target.value: Support the EPI TWGs (Service Delivery and Finance) to establish a fund allocation mechanism to districts, based on population density, access and use of immunização services and the existing health network, to equitably raise global coverage.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Financial/General Management

ToR elaborated to elaborate the EPI Sustainability Strategy: Country contextual analysis and identify potential sources of sustainable funding for the EPI beyond government and GAVI funding as well as propose

target.value: Support EPI TWG to develop the ToRs for EPI Sustainability Strategy

title.narrative: Active support to MoH team to ensure that: - PSR and related budget for HSS 2 approved and disbusred to country - HSS 2021 AWP + APP+ Budget approved and funds disbursed to country - HSS Grant funds execution - One TA plan for EPI TCA grant approved - ToRs of EPI TWG and Programmatic WG reviewed and approved - EPI TWG minutes - GPF reporte - EPI MA monthly report contribution

target.value: Overall support to EPI program through direct Technical Assitence based on MoH for planning, coordination, implementation, monitoring, reporting, collection of best practices from the different components of the EPI, particularly in the introduction of new vaccines, procurement and logistics, C4D, GAVI-TA

title.narrative: Delivrables: - MSD / JA report - TCA quarterly report - TWG minutes - HSS Implementation Progress Report - HSS Grant Execution level - GPF Report - EPI MA Monthly Report contribution

target.value: Overall support to EPI program through direct Technical Assitence based on MoH for planning, coordination, implementation, monitoring, reporting, collection of best practices from the different components of the EPI, particularly in the introduction of new vaccines, procurement and logistics, C4D, GAVI-TA

title.narrative: CDC Foundation : Health Information Systems (Data)

1. Laboratory and clinical staff for the three surveillance sites attend end of year workshop to evaluate ongoing surveillance for bacterial meningitis surveillance 2. Evaluate completeness of reporting using the following indicators: - Proportion of suspected meningitis cases with lumbar punctures performed (>90%) - Proportion of CSF specimens from meningitis patients with culture results/PCR results (100%) - Proportion of case report forms received at INS with complete information (100%) - Proportion of CSF specimens or isolates received at the national laboratory (100%) - Number of sites reporting hospital laboratory testing for meningitis cases monthly (3)

target.value: 1. Continue to provide epidemiologic and laboratory assistance for vaccine-preventable bacterial meningitis surveillance in three sentinel sites (Maputo, Nampula and Beira). 2.Provide technical assistance for molecular detection of vaccine-preventable bacterial pathogens for INS staff, including serotyping/serogrouping, and expand capacity to non-vaccine preventable bacterial pathogens causing meningitis that may be target for future vaccines such as GBS 3. Evaluate impact of the changes to the pneumococcal vaccination program on the serotypes causing meningitis

title.narrative: 1. Surveillance reported shared with the 3 sites and stakeholders on a quarterly basis 2. Evaluate completeness of reporting for suspected cases during Jun'20-May'21 using the same indicators: document any improvements to case reporting and % samples received at the national lab vs previous year 3. All INS laboratory staff working onprocessing samples for meningitis surveillance trained in molecular detection of vaccine-preventable and non-vaccine preventable bacterial pathogens causing meningitis and serotyping

target.value: 1. Continue to provide epidemiologic and laboratory assistance for vaccine-preventable bacterial meningitis surveillance in three sentinel sites (Maputo, Nampula and Beira). 2.Provide technical assistance for molecular detection of vaccine-preventable bacterial pathogens for INS staff, including serotyping/serogrouping, and expand capacity to non-vaccine preventable bacterial pathogens causing meningitis that may be target for future vaccines such as GBS 3. Evaluate impact of the changes to the pneumococcal vaccination program on the serotypes causing meningitis

1. Continue to provide epidemiologic and laboratory assistance for vaccine-preventable bacterial meningitis surveillance in three sentinel sites (Maputo, Nampula and Beira). 2.Provide technical assistance for molecular detection of vaccine-preventable bacterial pathogens for INS staff, including serotyping/serogrouping, and expand capacity to non-vaccine preventable bacterial pathogens causing meningitis that may be target for future vaccines such as GBS 3. Evaluate impact of the changes to the pneumococcal vaccination program on the serotypes causing meningitis

title.narrative: VillageReach : Health Information Systems (Data)
VAN management fully transitioned to MOH.

target.value: 1. Support the implementation of upgraded version of SELV, SELV V3 (based on OpenLMIS v3) a) Provide technical assistance to the deployment of SELV3 b) Provide technical assistance for information systems Integration, by collecting specifications for Interoperability between SELV V3 with DHIS2 c) Provide support for system operations, maintenance, and improvements based on feedback from users 2. Strengthen data analytics skills and the use of PAV Dashboard at central and provincial level where the provincial logistic working groups have been established. 3. Develop a VAN Skills Transfer Plan and Transition VAN management to the MoH.

1. Support the implementation of upgraded version of SELV, SELV V3 (based on OpenLMIS v3) a) Provide technical assistance to the deployment of SELV3 b) Provide technical assistance for information systems Integration, by collecting specifications for Interoperability between SELV V3 with DHIS2 c) Provide support for system operations, maintenance, and improvements based on feedback from users 2. Strengthen data analytics skills and the use of PAV Dashboard at central and provincial level where the provincial logistic working groups have been established. 3. Develop a VAN Skills Transfer Plan and Transition VAN management to the MoH.

title.narrative: VillageReach : Supply Chain & Procurement
100% of priority provinces are implementing the integration concept and SOPs for SC distribution.

target.value: 1. Based on the 2019 Vaccine Supply Chain Integration Workshop outputs, support iSC integration implementation in 3 provinces (Nampula, Tete, Zambezia). Including support for creating integrated distribution system and relevant SOPs. 2. Strengthen the capacity of the NLWG to manage and monitor implementation of EVM cIP and SC Integration at central level.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain
50% of the CCEOP deployement plan performed

target.value: Provide Technical Assistance for the supervision and maintenance of the cold chain at a national level within CCEOP

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Management - General
Overall EPI plans developed, implemented,monitored and evaluated in a coordinated manner

target.value: Overall support to EPI program through direct TA on planning, coordination, implementation, monitoring, reporting, evidence gathering of the different EPI components particularly on supply and logistics, C4D, GAVI-TA

Overall support to EPI program through direct TA on planning, coordination, implementation, monitoring, reporting, evidence gathering of the different EPI components particularly on supply and logistics, C4D, GAVI-TA

title.narrative:
a) Road map and methodology/structure to develop the EPI policy developed
b-c) High quality coordinated EPI and GAVI plans developed and submitted timely
d-f) ToR of Key EPI team members established and capacity development plan under way with KRA on leadership, results-based orientation and advocacy for resource mobilization identified and under regular evaluation
e) ICC functional and strengthened
f) Functional coordination mechanism in place

target.value: a) Have an EPI policy defined and disseminated by 2022 and establish leadership based on driving and guiding programme strategic priorities to deliver the cMYP. b) Ensure programme management structures are based on well-functioning coordination mechanisms at all levels, supported by timely and inclusive planning processes. c) Ensure programme decision-making, response and prioritisation is based on a solid foundation of evidence from monitoring, supervision, and relevant and up-to-date programme information. d) Engage programme stakeholders to proactively advocate for a strengthened EPI mandate and resourcing. e) Establish a robust governance mechanism which oversees and provides strategic guidance to the programme. f) Strengthen overall programme financial planning, management and reporting, focusing on efficiency, quality and resource mobilisation.

a) Have an EPI policy defined and disseminated by 2022 and establish leadership based on driving and guiding programme strategic priorities to deliver the cMYP. b) Ensure programme management structures are based on well-functioning coordination mechanisms at all levels, supported by timely and inclusive planning processes. c) Ensure programme decision-making, response and prioritisation is based on a solid foundation of evidence from monitoring, supervision, and relevant and up-to-date programme information. d) Engage programme stakeholders to proactively advocate for a strengthened EPI mandate and resourcing. e) Establish a robust governance mechanism which oversees and provides strategic guidance to the programme. f) Strengthen overall programme financial planning, management and reporting, focusing on efficiency, quality and resource mobilisation.

title.narrative: All identified MoH Staff in CMAM and National Vaccine Store are able to Forecast and Manage Supply Plans efficiently and effectively by 2021.

target.value: Provide technical advice in Forecasting, Supply Planning and Procurement and Delivery of Vaccines, Immunisation Supplies, Cold Chain Equipment for Mozambique. Provide procurement services for all PAV related supplies as needed such as Cold Chain Equipment.

Provide technical advice in Forecasting, Supply Planning and Procurement and Delivery of Vaccines, Immunisation Supplies, Cold Chain Equipment for Mozambique. Provide procurement services for all PAV related supplies as needed such as Cold Chain Equipment.

title.narrative: 100% of all Health Facilities have Cold Chain Equipment Replaced

target.value: a) Work with CHAI to pilot Cold Chain Maintenance outsourcing at the Health Facility and District Level in selected provinces and districts. b) Ensure Temperature Monitoring Devices are installed in all Cold Equipment at District and Health Facility in line with CCEOP to monitor all new and old refrigerators performance. c) Expand and rehabilitate the CC at all levels in line with the CCEOP ODP and new emerging needs and providing regular updates on ODP implementation status. Provide technical advice to resolve all ODP deviation in the field. d) Help Equip the Health Supply Chain Intermediary Warehouses in Manica(Chimoio) and Zambezia(Mocuba and Mopeia) and National Vaccine Store in Zimpeto with new cold rooms. Help equip the Regional warehouses in Beira, Sofala and Nampula with new CCE equipment as required to reach a level of preparedness as the point of entry and distribution of immunisation supplies to reduce transport costs and time. e) Work with CHAI, CMAM and provinces to completely outsource Cold Chain Equipment , generators and buildings maintenance at central, provincial and intermediary warehouse levels.

a) Work with CHAI to pilot Cold Chain Maintenance outsourcing at the Health Facility and District Level in selected provinces and districts. b) Ensure Temperature Monitoring Devices are installed in all Cold Equipment at District and Health Facility in line with CCEOP to monitor all new and old refrigerators performance. c) Expand and rehabilitate the CC at all levels in line with the CCEOP ODP and new emerging needs and providing regular updates on ODP implementation status. Provide technical advice to resolve all ODP deviation in the field. d) Help Equip the Health Supply Chain Intermediary Warehouses in Manica(Chimoio) and Zambezia(Mocuba and Mopeia) and National Vaccine Store in Zimpeto with new cold rooms. Help equip the Regional warehouses in Beira, Sofala and Nampula with new CCE equipment as required to reach a level of preparedness as the point of entry and distribution of immunisation supplies to reduce transport costs and time. e) Work with CHAI, CMAM and provinces to completely outsource Cold Chain Equipment , generators and buildings maintenance at central, provincial and intermediary warehouse levels.
